activities: Twitter, Inc. receives and processes personal information from users of its communication services within the EU/EEA and Switzerland. Twitter, Inc. also serves as a data processor to Twitter International Company (TIC), which processes personal information relating to natural persons in the EU/EEA and Switzerland who are employees of TIC or individual contacts of corporate customers (including advertisers), suppliers, service providers and other corporate business partners of TIC. As a data processor Twitter, Inc. provides web hosting and technical services, human resources, sales and marketing support, and technical services for TIC, which controls such data and processing. The personal information described above is collected, held and processed for different purposes, which may include any of the following: to provide the Twitter services and to measure and improve them over time; for sales and marketing to businesses; effecting transactions with businesses; supplying services and/or products to such businesses; financial processing and management; supplier relationship management; customer support and customer relationship management; and human resources purposes.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Online and offline customer and employee data which may be manually processed
recoursemech: EU data protection authorities and the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner pursuant to the Safe Harbor certification.
